about_the_game:
"Flesh and blood" jazz musicians have made this original soundtrack what it always set out to be: humane and unique at every registered note. Irresistible, gloomy and fatally seductive in its entirety.

Recorded in a live-act environment, under the proverbial "whip" of azorean composer Cristóvão Ferreira, six impactful tracks help Pecaminosa invoke a soundscape that highlights vintage jazz and the noir genre.

With original soundtrack references like Les Liaison Dangereuses (Art Blakey), Ascenseur pour l’échafau (Miles Davis) and Touch of Evil (Henry Mancini), this "made in Azores" noir jazz is going out at the crack of dawn and would like to take you for a ride through obscure, noisy alleyways, smoke-filled bars and stolen kisses. Are you in?
